text:
The danger posed by TikTok is NOT the videos or messages people post. The danger is that the data it collects is owned by a company that must turn it over to #China if they want it. 

The answer is for it to be sold to a company not under the Chinese Communist Party’s control.

#Florida continued downward trend of cases & hospitalizations is very good news. Death rate,which is a lagging indicator should begin to drop soon as well. 

Let’s keep it going so we #DontCancelOctober

Lead me from the way of deceit;favor me with your law.

Psalms 119:29

FL and NY have an identical number of per capita coronavirus infections but FL has 5X less per capita deaths. Will Dr. Fauci be praising @GovRonDeSantis’ response to the pandemic?  Will he point out that @NYGovCuomo’s response allowed a fivefold greater per capita death rate?

The expiration of the $600 weekly unemployment benefit is catastrophic for people all over the country. American families are in crisis and they need help. 

The President and Senate Republicans should be able to agree that we need to renew this lifeline immediately.

RT @JoaquinCastrotx One year ago, in the beautiful bi-national community of El Paso, 23 people were killed and 22 wounded — an act of anti-Latino terror motivated by hate.

We must honor their lives by disarming hate, dismantling white supremacy and healing our nation with love. #ElPasoStrong http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EegLBMWWAA0PpL9.png https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1290290619051638785/vid/480x270/Fbd3IChH8DGIRzQG.mp4?tag=13

One year ago, a deranged white supremacist committed an act of unspeakable evil that shook El Paso and left the nation weeping. Today we remember the 23 people who lost their lives, and their families and loved ones who carry the weight of this day on their hearts. #ElPasoStrong

One year ago 23 lives were cut short in El Paso—the deadliest attack against the Latinx community in recent American history. An attack fueled by the flames of hate and division. 
 
Gun violence is a national emergency in our country. It must be treated as such. #ElPasoStrong

Smithfield didn’t provide answers to the workplace safety questions @SenBooker & I raised – they provided attitude. We need an @OSHA_DOL Emergency Temporary Standard for COVID-19 & an Essential Workers Bill of Rights to hold @SmithfieldFoods accountable for protecting workers.

An estimated 2,000+ workers at @SmithfieldFoods facilities have become sick with COVID-19. Some have died. Smithfield took @OSHA_DOL to court to keep data on their biggest outbreak private.

Asking about the safety and survival of Smithfield workers is not baseless criticism.

Instead of investing in their workers’ safety, @SmithfieldFoods ran a full-page Sunday @NYTimes ad – whining that they’re being treated unfairly after they rigged the rules to exploit the pandemic and put thousands of lives at risk. Well boo-hoo, Smithfield.

These reports out of Philadelphia are a frightening preview of what's to come if we don't fully fund the Postal Service. 

This has dramatic consequences not only for the election, but for everyone who relies on @USPS for paychecks, essential supplies, and lifesaving medications. https://twitter.com/Elaijuh/status/1289937355160186884 QT @Elaijuh Some Philly neighborhoods are going WEEKS without mail. It’s piling up, with long delays and sporadic delivery.

Why? The coronavirus, budget cuts, and new USPS postmaster general’s policies.

This could really affect voting by mail.

From @EllieRushing:
https://www.inquirer.com/news/philadelphia/usps-tracking-in-transit-late-mail-delivery-philadelphia-packages-postal-service-20200802.html

I have worked with @SenatorCP for decades.  He is a strong progressive who will continue to lead the fight for economic, social, racial and environmental justice.
